custom_item_2.description: OpenStack Networking - user/group ownership of config files set to root/neutron - /etc/neutron/neutron.conf
custom_item_2.info: Configuration files contain critical parameters and information required for smooth functioning of the component. If an unprivileged user, either intentionally or accidentally modifies or deletes any of the parameters or the file itself then it would cause severe availability issues causing a denial of service to the other end users. Thus user ownership of such critical configuration files must be set to root and group ownership must be set to nova.
custom_item_2.solution: Set user and group ownership of these config files to root and neutron respectively

custom_item_3.description: OpenStack Networking - user/group ownership of config files set to root/neutron - /etc/neutron/api-paste.ini

If an unprivileged user, either intentionally or accidentally modifies or deletes any of the parameters or the file itself then it would cause severe availability issues causing a denial of service to the other end users. Thus user ownership of such critical configuration files must be set to root and group ownership must be set to nova.
custom_item_3.solution: Set user and group ownership of these config files to root and neutron respectively

custom_item_6.description: OpenStack Networking - strict permissions set for Compute configuration files - /etc/neutron/neutron.conf
custom_item_6.info: It is recommended to set strict access permissions for configuration files. 640 or better.

custom_item_7.description: OpenStack Networking - strict permissions set for Compute configuration files - /etc/neutron/api-paste.ini
custom_item_7.info: It is recommended to set strict access permissions for configuration files. 640 or better.

custom_item_8.description: OpenStack Networking - strict permissions set for Compute configuration files - /etc/neutron/policy.json
custom_item_8.info: It is recommended to set strict access permissions for configuration files. 640 or better.

custom_item_9.description: OpenStack Networking - strict permissions set for Compute configuration files - /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf
custom_item_9.info: It is recommended to set strict access permissions for configuration files. 640 or better.

custom_item_10.description: OpenStack Networking - keystone used for authentication
custom_item_10.info: OpenStack supports various authentication strategies like noauth, keystone etc. If the 'noauth' strategy is used then the users could interact with OpenStack services without any authentication. This could be a potential risk since an attacker might gain unauthorized access to the OpenStack components. Thus it is strongly recommended that all services must be authenticated with keystone using their service accounts.
custom_item_10.solution: Set the value of parameter 'auth_strategy' under [DEFAULT] section in /etc/neutron/neutron.conf to keystone

custom_item_11.description: OpenStack Networking - secure protocol used for authentication - auth_protocol

custom_item_12.description: OpenStack Networking - secure protocol used for authentication - identity_uri

custom_item_13.description: OpenStack Networking - SSL enabled on Neutron API server
custom_item_13.info: it is recommended to enable secure communication on API server.
custom_item_13.solution: Set the value of parameter use_ssl under [DEFAULT] section in /etc/neutron/neutron.conf to True.
